p: In the case of the antidepressant activity assay, the compounds T-cadinol (−6.892 kcal/mol), oplodiol (−6.948 kcal/mol) and α-cadinene (−7.188 kcal/mol) of essential oils in leaves of H. aromatica showed the docking score near about while standard drug imipramine hydrochloride has 8.171 kcal/mol docking score ( Table 5). α-Cadinene presented a better docking score than other compounds present in leaves of H. aromatica against human serotonin receptor by interacting with four hydrophobic bonds (ILE172, VAL501, TYR95 and PHE341) ( Figure 9).
